column1: 1090C698-81E1-4969-A05C-01BD49D368D2#appfire#0584A92F-1E9D-4E4E-9000-0B7ECCA83267#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-29 12:46:15.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-29 12:46:15.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#2E237E1F-D4D9-4F70-B642-455424FEE51F#appfire#0584A92F-1E9D-4E4E-9000-0B7ECCA83267#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-29 12:46:15.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-29 12:46:15.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#3C31F1C8-2573-4980-98A3-27943D1D6B07#appfire#0584A92F-1E9D-4E4E-9000-0B7ECCA83267#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-29 12:46:15.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-29 12:46:15.0#appfire#1
